metadata.description: A classic 3-day split for beginners using machines and dumbbells to build technique before progressing to barbell work.
metadata.recommendation: Perform each workout once per week with at least one rest day between sessions — e.g. Monday / Wednesday / Friday. Rest 60–90 seconds between sets. Aim for 3 sets of 10–12 reps per exercise.

metadata.description: A simple 2-day dumbbell routine for busy schedules. Each session covers all major muscle groups with beginner-friendly movements.
metadata.recommendation: Perform each workout once per week with at least 2 rest days between sessions — e.g. Monday / Thursday. Rest 60–90 seconds between sets. Aim for 3 sets of 10–12 reps per exercise.

metadata.description: Classic 6-day Push/Pull/Legs split for intermediate lifters seeking maximum hypertrophy.
metadata.recommendation: Run as a 6-day rotation — Push / Pull / Legs / Push / Pull / Legs / Rest. Rest 60–90 seconds between sets. Aim for 4 sets of 8–10 reps on compounds, 3 sets of 10–12 reps on isolations.

exercises.name: Calf Press on a Leg Press Machine

metadata.description: High-volume PPL for advanced lifters with periodization and intensity techniques.
metadata.recommendation: Run as a 6-day rotation — Push / Pull / Legs / Push / Pull / Legs / Rest. Heavy days: 4–5 sets of 5–8 reps. Volume days: 4 sets of 10–15 reps. Rest 2–3 minutes on heavy compounds, 60–90 seconds on isolations.

exercises.name: Calf Press on a Leg Press Machine

metadata.description: Simple 4-day upper/lower split perfect for beginners building a foundation.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Friday. Rest 60–90 seconds between sets. Aim for 3 sets of 10–12 reps on compounds, 2–3 sets of 12–15 reps on isolations.

exercises.name: Calf Press on a Leg Press Machine

metadata.description: Progressive overload focused upper/lower split for intermediate lifters.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Friday. Strength days: 4 sets of 6–8 reps, rest 2–3 minutes. Hypertrophy days: 3–4 sets of 10–12 reps, rest 60–90 seconds. Increase weight when you hit the top of the rep range.

exercises.name: Calf Press on a Leg Press Machine

metadata.description: Push/Pull/Legs split using only dumbbells - perfect for home gyms.
metadata.recommendation: Perform each workout once per week with a rest day between sessions — e.g. Monday / Wednesday / Friday. Rest 60–90 seconds between sets. Aim for 4 sets of 8–10 reps on compounds, 3 sets of 10–12 reps on isolations.

metadata.description: Build muscle with zero equipment using progressive calisthenics.
metadata.recommendation: Perform each workout once per week with at least one rest day between sessions — e.g. Monday / Wednesday / Friday. Aim for 3–4 sets of as many quality reps as possible (AMRAP). Rest 60–90 seconds between sets.

metadata.description: Barbell-focused linear progression for beginners. Start with the bar and add weight every session on the big compound lifts.
metadata.recommendation: Alternate Workout A and B three times per week — e.g. Week 1: A/B/A, Week 2: B/A/B. Rest 3–5 minutes between sets. Perform 3 sets of 5 reps (squats and bench/press) and 1 set of 5 reps (deadlift). Add 5 lbs each session.

metadata.description: 5/3/1 style programming for intermediate strength athletes.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Friday. Main lifts: follow 5/3/1 percentages (5 sets). Accessories: 3–4 sets of 8–12 reps. Rest 3–5 minutes on main lifts, 60–90 seconds on accessories.

metadata.description: Periodized powerlifting program for advanced strength athletes.
metadata.recommendation: Train 5 days per week — e.g. Monday through Friday with weekends off. Main lifts: 5–6 sets of 3–5 reps with heavy weight. Accessories: 3–4 sets of 8–12 reps. Rest 3–5 minutes on main lifts, 90–120 seconds on accessories.

metadata.description: Build strength using only dumbbells with heavy compound movements.
metadata.recommendation: Perform each workout once per week with a rest day between sessions — e.g. Monday / Wednesday / Friday. Rest 90–120 seconds between sets. Aim for 4–5 sets of 5–8 reps on compounds, 3 sets of 8–10 reps on isolations.

metadata.description: Circuit-style training for beginners focused on calorie burn.
metadata.recommendation: Perform each circuit once per week with at least one rest day between sessions — e.g. Monday / Wednesday / Friday. Move quickly between exercises with 30–45 seconds rest. Aim for 3 sets of 12–15 reps per exercise.

metadata.description: HIIT combined with strength training for maximum fat burning.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Friday. Strength days: 3–4 sets of 8–12 reps, rest 60–90 seconds. HIIT days: perform exercises as a circuit with minimal rest. Full body: 3 sets of 10–12 reps.

metadata.description: No-equipment fat burning program you can do anywhere.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Saturday. Perform exercises as a circuit with 20–30 seconds rest between exercises. Rest 60–90 seconds between rounds. Aim for 3–4 rounds.

metadata.description: Well-rounded program balancing strength and conditioning.
metadata.recommendation: Perform each workout once per week with a rest day between sessions — e.g. Monday / Wednesday / Friday. Strength day: 4 sets of 6–8 reps, rest 2–3 minutes. Conditioning: circuit style with 45–60 seconds rest. Full body: 3–4 sets of 8–10 reps.

metadata.description: Well-rounded fitness program using only dumbbells.
metadata.recommendation: Perform each workout once per week with at least one rest day between sessions — e.g. Monday / Wednesday / Friday. Rest 60–90 seconds between sets. Aim for 3 sets of 10–12 reps per exercise.

metadata.description: Progressive calisthenics for overall fitness and athleticism.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Saturday. Aim for 3–4 sets of as many quality reps as possible (AMRAP). Rest 60–90 seconds between sets. Progress by adding reps before adding sets.

metadata.description: Classic bodybuilding split training one muscle group per day.
metadata.recommendation: Train 5 days per week — e.g. Monday through Friday with weekends off. Aim for 3–4 sets of 8–12 reps on compounds, 3 sets of 10–15 reps on isolations. Rest 90–120 seconds between sets.

exercises.name: Seated Bent Over Rear Delt Raise

metadata.description: High-frequency upper/lower split for advanced lifters.
metadata.recommendation: Train 5 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Friday / Saturday. Power days: 4–5 sets of 4–6 reps, rest 2–3 minutes. Hypertrophy days: 3–4 sets of 10–12 reps, rest 60–90 seconds. Volume day: 3–4 sets of 8–10 reps.

exercises.name: Calf Press on a Leg Press Machine

metadata.description: Blend of powerlifting and bodybuilding for strength and size.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Friday. Main lifts: 5 sets of 3–5 reps with heavy weight. Accessories: 3–4 sets of 8–12 reps. Rest 3–5 minutes on main lifts, 60–90 seconds on accessories.

metadata.description: Upper/lower split using only dumbbells for home gym training.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Friday. Aim for 3–4 sets of 8–12 reps per exercise. Rest 60–90 seconds between sets. Increase dumbbell weight when you can complete all sets at the top of the rep range.

metadata.description: Progressive bodyweight strength training with skill work.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Saturday. Aim for 4–5 sets of 3–8 reps on strength exercises. Rest 2–3 minutes between sets. Progress by adding reps, then harder variations.

metadata.description: High-intensity interval training for rapid fat loss.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Saturday. Perform exercises as a circuit with 15–20 seconds rest between exercises. Rest 60–90 seconds between rounds. Aim for 4–5 rounds per workout.

metadata.description: Efficient 3-day full body split for busy intermediate lifters.
metadata.recommendation: Perform each workout once per week with at least one rest day between sessions — e.g. Monday / Wednesday / Friday. Aim for 3–4 sets of 8–10 reps on compounds, 3 sets of 10–12 reps on isolations. Rest 90–120 seconds between sets.

metadata.description: Sport-specific training for explosive power and athleticism.
metadata.recommendation: Train 4 days per week — e.g. Monday / Tuesday / Thursday / Saturday. Power day: 4–5 sets of 3–5 reps, explosive tempo. Strength day: 4 sets of 5–8 reps. Speed day: max effort intervals. Conditioning: circuit style.

metadata.description: Safe machine-based program for complete beginners.
metadata.recommendation: Perform each workout once per week with at least one rest day between sessions — e.g. Monday / Wednesday / Friday. Rest 60–90 seconds between sets. Aim for 3 sets of 12–15 reps per exercise. Focus on controlled form.

metadata.description: Bare minimum effective training for busy schedules.
metadata.recommendation: Alternate Workout A and B twice per week — e.g. Monday / Thursday. Rest 3–5 minutes between sets. Aim for 3 sets of 5 reps per exercise. Add 5 lbs each session when you complete all reps.

metadata.description: High-volume dumbbell bodybuilding split for home gyms.
metadata.recommendation: Run as a 6-day rotation with one rest day per week. Aim for 4–5 sets of 8–12 reps per exercise. Rest 60–90 seconds between sets. Use heavy dumbbells and focus on progressive overload.

metadata.description: Varied functional fitness with strength, cardio, and gymnastics.
metadata.recommendation: Train 5 days per week — e.g. Monday through Friday with weekends off. Strength day: 5 sets of 3–5 reps. MetCon/WOD: circuit style with minimal rest. Gymnastics: skill work with 2–3 minute rest. Endurance: sustained effort.
